meanings.definition: The collective community or society of people living in villas.
meanings.sent1: In the small villadom, everyone knew each other and helped out.
meanings.sent2: The villadom was filled with beautiful houses and well-kept gardens.
meanings.sent3: The annual villadom picnic was a highlight of the summer, with games and laughter.
meanings.sent4: She saw the villadom as a colorful tapestry of different families woven together.
meanings.sent5: The villadom bustled with activity, like a busy beehive.

meanings.definition: The lifestyle or characteristics associated with living in a villa.
meanings.sent1: Their elegant clothing and refined manners reflected the villadom they belonged to.
meanings.sent2: Living in villadom meant enjoying the peaceful surroundings and luxurious amenities.
meanings.sent3: She embraced the villadom lifestyle, spending evenings sipping tea on the veranda.
meanings.sent4: The villadom charm was evident in the architecture and lush landscapes.
meanings.sent5: The essence of villadom was captured in the serene atmosphere of the neighborhood.
